sentence.Network_en: The harmonization theory sees international law and muncipal law as concordant bodies of doctrine.
sentence.Network_cn: 协调说认为国际法和国内法是和谐一致的学说体系.

sentence.Network_en: What we sought was harmonization of seperate judgments, not a legal document that proscribed different opinions.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们谋求的是各自观点的协调, 不是不准有不同看法的法规.

sentence.Network_en: Management representative become qualified for the right of interpretation and harmonization.
sentence.Network_cn: 本手册的解释权及未尽事宜的协调权,属于管理者代表.

entry.def: If two or more things harmonize with each other, they fit in well with each other.

example.ex: ...slabs of pink and beige stone that harmonize with the carpet...
example.tran: 与地毯协调搭配的粉色和米色相间的石板

example.ex: Barbara White and her mother like to listen to music together, though their tastes don't harmonize.
example.tran: 尽管芭芭拉·怀特和她的母亲音乐品味不太一致，她们还是喜欢一起听音乐。

entry.tran: 使（法律、制度或规则）协调;使统一
entry.def: When governments or organizations harmonize laws, systems, or regulations, they agree in a friendly way to make them the same or similar.

example.ex: How far will members have progressed towards harmonising their economies?
example.tran: 各成员国在使彼此经济协调一致的进程上会有多大进展？

entry.tran: 用和声唱（或演奏）;为（主调）配和声
entry.def: When people harmonize, they sing or play notes which are different from the main tune but which sound nice with it.

example.ex: Bremer and Garland harmonize on the title song, 'Meet Me in St. Louis'.
example.tran: 布雷默和加兰为主题曲《相逢圣路易斯》配和声。

auth_sentence.content: The forum will also promote the harmonization of national legislation and policies promoting STI for development.
